00060 sub new
00061 {
00062     croak "Usage: \$new_matrix = MatrixReal1->new(\$rows,\$columns);"
00063       if (@_ != 3);
00064 
00065     my $proto = shift;
00066     my $class = ref($proto) || $proto || 'MatrixReal1';
00067     my $rows = shift;
00068     my $cols = shift;
00069     my($i,$j);
00070     my($this);
00071 
00072     croak "MatrixReal1::new(): number of rows must be > 0"
00073       if ($rows <= 0);
00074 
00075     croak "MatrixReal1::new(): number of columns must be > 0"
00076       if ($cols <= 0);
00077 
00078 #    $this = [ [ ], $rows, $cols ];
00079     $this = [ [ ], $rows, $cols ];  
00080     $this->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY] = {};   # added a holder for options MEG
00081                                                 # see also modifications to LR decomposition
00082 
00083     # Creates first empty row
00084     my $empty = [ ];
00085     $#$empty = $cols - 1; # Lengthens the array
00086     for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++)
00087     {
00088     $empty->[$j] = 0.0;
00089     }
00090     $this->[0][0] = $empty;
00091     # Creates other rows (by copying)
00092     for (my $i = 1; $i < $rows; $i++)
00093     {
00094     my $arow = [ ];
00095     @$arow = @$empty;
00096     $this->[0][$i] = $arow;
00097     }
00098     bless($this, $class);
00099     return($this);
00100 }

00102 sub new_from_string
00103 {
00104     croak "Usage: \$new_matrix = MatrixReal1->new_from_string(\$string);"
00105       if (@_ != 2);
00106 
00107     my $proto  = shift;
00108     my $class  = ref($proto) || $proto || 'MatrixReal1';
00109     my $string = shift;
00110     my($line,$values);
00111     my($rows,$cols);
00112     my($row,$col);
00113     my($warn);
00114     my($this);
00115 
00116     $warn = 0;
00117     $rows = 0;
00118     $cols = 0;
00119     $values = [ ];
00120     while ($string =~ m!^\s*
00121   \[ \s+ ( (?: [+-]? \d+ (?: \. \d* )? (?: E [+-]? \d+ )? \s+ )+ ) \] \s*? \n
00122     !x)
00123     {
00124         $line = $1;
00125         $string = $';
00126         $values->[$rows] = [ ];
00127         @{$values->[$rows]} = split(' ', $line);
00128         $col = @{$values->[$rows]};
00129         if ($col != $cols)
00130         {
00131             unless ($cols == 0) { $warn = 1; }
00132             if ($col > $cols) { $cols = $col; }
00133         }
00134         $rows++;
00135     }
00136     if ($string !~ m!^\s*$!)
00137     {
00138         croak "MatrixReal1::new_from_string(): syntax error in input string";
00139     }
00140     if ($rows == 0)
00141     {
00142         croak "MatrixReal1::new_from_string(): empty input string";
00143     }
00144     if ($warn)
00145     {
00146         warn "MatrixReal1::new_from_string(): missing elements will be set to zero!\n";
00147     }
00148     $this = MatrixReal1::new($class,$rows,$cols);
00149     for ( $row = 0; $row < $rows; $row++ )
00150     {
00151         for ( $col = 0; $col < @{$values->[$row]}; $col++ )
00152         {
00153             $this->[0][$row][$col] = $values->[$row][$col];
00154         }
00155     }
00156     return($this);
00157 }

00172 sub copy
00173 {
00174     croak "Usage: \$matrix1->copy(\$matrix2);"
00175       if (@_ != 2);
00176 
00177     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00178     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00179     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00180     my($i,$j);
00181 
00182     croak "MatrixReal1::copy(): matrix size mismatch"
00183       unless (($rows1 == $rows2) && ($cols1 == $cols2));
00184 
00185     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++ )
00186     {
00187     my $r1 = []; # New array ref
00188     my $r2 = $matrix2->[0][$i];
00189     @$r1 = @$r2; # Copy whole array directly
00190     $matrix1->[0][$i] = $r1;
00191     }
00192         $matrix1->[3] = $matrix2->[3]; # sign or option
00193     if (defined $matrix2->[4]) # is an LR decomposition matrix!
00194     {
00195     #    $matrix1->[3] = $matrix2->[3]; # $sign
00196         $matrix1->[4] = $matrix2->[4]; # $perm_row
00197         $matrix1->[5] = $matrix2->[5]; # $perm_col
00198         $matrix1->[6] = $matrix2->[6]; # $option
00199     }
00200 }

00215 sub row
00216 {
00217     croak "Usage: \$row_vector = \$matrix->row(\$row);"
00218       if (@_ != 2);
00219 
00220     my($matrix,$row) = @_;
00221     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00222     my($temp);
00223     my($j);
00224 
00225     croak "MatrixReal1::row(): row index out of range"
00226       if (($row < 1) || ($row > $rows));
00227 
00228     $row--;
00229     $temp = $matrix->new(1,$cols);
00230     for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
00231     {
00232         $temp->[0][0][$j] = $matrix->[0][$row][$j];
00233     }
00234     return($temp);

00259 sub _undo_LR  # I don't think gives original matrix. LR is not the same as the original matrix
00260 {
00261     croak "Usage: \$matrix->_undo_LR();"
00262       if (@_ != 1);
00263 
00264     my($this) = @_;
00265     my $rh_options = $this->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY];
00266     undef $this->[3];
00267     undef $this->[4];
00268     undef $this->[5];
00269     undef $this->[6];
00270     $this->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY] = $rh_options;
00271 }

00273 sub zero
00274 {
00275     croak "Usage: \$matrix->zero();"
00276       if (@_ != 1);
00277 
00278     my($this) = @_;
00279     my($rows,$cols) = ($this->[1],$this->[2]);
00280     my($i,$j);
00281 
00282     $this->_undo_LR();
00283 
00284     # Zero first row
00285     for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
00286     {
00287     $this->[0][0][$j] = 0.0;
00288     }
00289     # Then propagate to other rows
00290     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
00291     {
00292     @{$this->[0][$i]} = @{$this->[0][0]};
00293     }
00294 }

00306 #    $this->_undo_LR();
00307     $this->zero(); # We rely on zero() efficiency
00308     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
00309     {
00310         $this->[0][$i][$i] = 1.0;

00314 sub assign
00315 {
00316     croak "Usage: \$matrix->assign(\$row,\$column,\$value);"
00317       if (@_ != 4);
00318 
00319     my($this,$row,$col,$value) = @_;
00320     my($rows,$cols) = ($this->[1],$this->[2]);
00321 
00322     croak "MatrixReal1::assign(): row index out of range"
00323       if (($row < 1) || ($row > $rows));
00324 
00325     croak "MatrixReal1::assign(): column index out of range"
00326       if (($col < 1) || ($col > $cols));
00327 
00328     $this->_undo_LR();
00329 
00330     $this->[0][--$row][--$col] = $value;
00331 }

00360 sub norm_one  #  maximum of sums of each column
00361 {
00362     croak "Usage: \$norm_one = \$matrix->norm_one();"
00363       if (@_ != 1);
00364 
00365     my($this) = @_;
00366     my($rows,$cols) = ($this->[1],$this->[2]);
00367 
00368     my $max = 0.0;
00369     for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++)
00370     {
00371         my $sum = 0.0;
00372         for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
00373         {
00374             $sum += abs( $this->[0][$i][$j] );
00375         }
00376     $max = $sum if ($sum > $max);
00377     }
00378     return($max);
00379 }
00380

00392         my $sum = 0.0;
00393         for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++)
00394         {
00395             $sum += abs( $this->[0][$i][$j] );

00408     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);

00410 
00411     croak "MatrixReal1::negate(): matrix size mismatch"
00412       unless (($rows1 == $rows2) && ($cols1 == $cols2));
00413 
00414     $matrix1->_undo_LR();
00415 
00416     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++ )
00417     {
00418         for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols1; $j++ )
00419         {
00420             $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] = -($matrix2->[0][$i][$j]);
00421         }
00422     }

00425 sub transpose
00426 {
00427     croak "Usage: \$matrix1->transpose(\$matrix2);"
00428       if (@_ != 2);
00429 
00430     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00431     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00432     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00433 
00434     croak "MatrixReal1::transpose(): matrix size mismatch"
00435       unless (($rows1 == $cols2) && ($cols1 == $rows2));
00436 
00437     $matrix1->_undo_LR();
00438 
00439     if ($rows1 == $cols1)
00440     {
00441         # more complicated to make in-place possible!
00442 
00443         for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++)
00444         {
00445             for (my $j = ($i + 1); $j < $cols1; $j++)
00446             {
00447                 my $swap              = $matrix2->[0][$i][$j];
00448                 $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] = $matrix2->[0][$j][$i];
00449                 $matrix1->[0][$j][$i] = $swap;
00450             }
00451             $matrix1->[0][$i][$i] = $matrix2->[0][$i][$i];
00452         }
00453     }
00454     else # ($rows1 != $cols1)
00455     {
00456         for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++)
00457         {
00458             for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols1; $j++)
00459             {
00460                 $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] = $matrix2->[0][$j][$i];
00461             }
00462         }
00463     }
00464 }

00468     croak "Usage: \$matrix1->add(\$matrix2,\$matrix3);"
00469       if (@_ != 3);
00470 
00471     my($matrix1,$matrix2,$matrix3) = @_;
00472     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);

00475     my($i,$j);
00476 
00477     croak "MatrixReal1::add(): matrix size mismatch"
00478       unless (($rows1 == $rows2) && ($rows1 == $rows3) &&
00479               ($cols1 == $cols2) && ($cols1 == $cols3));
00480 
00481     $matrix1->_undo_LR();
00482 
00483     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++ )
00484     {
00485         for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols1; $j++ )
00486         {
00487             $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] =
00488             $matrix2->[0][$i][$j] + $matrix3->[0][$i][$j];
00489         }
00490     }

00544 sub multiply
00545 {
00546     croak "Usage: \$product_matrix = \$matrix1->multiply(\$matrix2);"
00547       if (@_ != 2);
00548 
00549     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00550     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00551     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00552     my($temp);
00553 
00554     croak "MatrixReal1::multiply(): matrix size mismatch"
00555       unless ($cols1 == $rows2);
00556 
00557     $temp = $matrix1->new($rows1,$cols2);
00558     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++ )
00559     {
00560         for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols2; $j++ )
00561         {
00562             my $sum = 0.0;
00563             for (my $k = 0; $k < $cols1; $k++ )
00564             {
00565           $sum += ( $matrix1->[0][$i][$k] * $matrix2->[0][$k][$j] );
00566             }
00567             $temp->[0][$i][$j] = $sum;
00568         }
00569     }
00570     return($temp);
00571 }

00589 sub kleene
00590 {
00591     croak "Usage: \$minimal_cost_matrix = \$cost_matrix->kleene();"
00592       if (@_ != 1);
00593 
00594     my($matrix) = @_;
00595     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00596     my($i,$j,$k,$n);
00597     my($temp);
00598 
00599     croak "MatrixReal1::kleene(): matrix is not quadratic"
00600       unless ($rows == $cols);
00601 
00602     $temp = $matrix->new($rows,$cols);
00603     $temp->copy($matrix);
00604     $temp->_undo_LR();
00605     $n = $rows;
00606     for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00607     {
00608         $temp->[0][$i][$i] = min( $temp->[0][$i][$i] , 0 );
00609     }
00610     for ( $k = 0; $k < $n; $k++ )
00611     {
00612         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00613         {
00614             for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
00615             {
00616                 $temp->[0][$i][$j] = min( $temp->[0][$i][$j] ,
00617                                         ( $temp->[0][$i][$k] +
00618                                           $temp->[0][$k][$j] ) );
00619             }
00620         }
00621     }
00622     return($temp);
00623 }

00625 sub normalize
00626 {
00627     croak "Usage: (\$norm_matrix,\$norm_vector) = \$matrix->normalize(\$vector);"
00628       if (@_ != 2);
00629 
00630     my($matrix,$vector) = @_;
00631     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00632     my($norm_matrix,$norm_vector);
00633     my($max,$val);
00634     my($i,$j,$n);
00635 
00636     croak "MatrixReal1::normalize(): matrix is not quadratic"
00637       unless ($rows == $cols);
00638 
00639     $n = $rows;
00640 
00641     croak "MatrixReal1::normalize(): vector is not a column vector"
00642       unless ($vector->[2] == 1);
00643 
00644     croak "MatrixReal1::normalize(): matrix and vector size mismatch"
00645       unless ($vector->[1] == $n);
00646 
00647     $norm_matrix = $matrix->new($n,$n);
00648     $norm_vector = $vector->new($n,1);
00649 
00650     $norm_matrix->copy($matrix);
00651     $norm_vector->copy($vector);
00652 
00653     $norm_matrix->_undo_LR();
00654 
00655     for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00656     {
00657         $max = abs($norm_vector->[0][$i][0]);
00658         for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
00659         {
00660             $val = abs($norm_matrix->[0][$i][$j]);
00661             if ($val > $max) { $max = $val; }
00662         }
00663         if ($max != 0)
00664         {
00665             $norm_vector->[0][$i][0] /= $max;
00666             for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
00667             {
00668                 $norm_matrix->[0][$i][$j] /= $max;
00669             }
00670         }
00671     }
00672     return($norm_matrix,$norm_vector);
00673 }
00674 
00675 sub decompose_LR
00676 {
00677     croak "Usage: \$LR_matrix = \$matrix->decompose_LR();"
00678       if (@_ != 1);
00679 
00680     my($matrix) = @_;
00681     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00682     my($perm_row,$perm_col);
00683     my($row,$col,$max);
00684     my($i,$j,$k,$n);
00685     my($sign) = 1;
00686     my($swap);
00687     my($temp);
00688 
00689     croak "MatrixReal1::decompose_LR(): matrix is not quadratic"
00690       unless ($rows == $cols);
00691 
00692     $temp = $matrix->new($rows,$cols);
00693     $temp->copy($matrix);
00694     $n = $rows;
00695     $perm_row = [ ];
00696     $perm_col = [ ];
00697     for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00698     {
00699         $perm_row->[$i] = $i;
00700         $perm_col->[$i] = $i;
00701     }
00702     NONZERO:
00703     for ( $k = 0; $k < $n; $k++ ) # use Gauss's algorithm:
00704     {
00705         # complete pivot-search:
00706 
00707         $max = 0;
00708         for ( $i = $k; $i < $n; $i++ )
00709         {
00710             for ( $j = $k; $j < $n; $j++ )
00711             {
00712                 if (($swap = abs($temp->[0][$i][$j])) > $max)
00713                 {
00714                     $max = $swap;
00715                     $row = $i;
00716                     $col = $j;
00717                 }
00718             }
00719         }
00720         last NONZERO if ($max == 0); # (all remaining elements are zero)
00721         if ($k != $row) # swap row $k and row $row:
00722         {
00723             $sign = -$sign;
00724             $swap             = $perm_row->[$k];
00725             $perm_row->[$k]   = $perm_row->[$row];
00726             $perm_row->[$row] = $swap;
00727             for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
00728             {
00729                 # (must run from 0 since L has to be swapped too!)
00730 
00731                 $swap                = $temp->[0][$k][$j];
00732                 $temp->[0][$k][$j]   = $temp->[0][$row][$j];
00733                 $temp->[0][$row][$j] = $swap;
00734             }
00735         }
00736         if ($k != $col) # swap column $k and column $col:
00737         {
00738             $sign = -$sign;
00739             $swap             = $perm_col->[$k];
00740             $perm_col->[$k]   = $perm_col->[$col];
00741             $perm_col->[$col] = $swap;
00742             for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00743             {
00744                 $swap                = $temp->[0][$i][$k];
00745                 $temp->[0][$i][$k]   = $temp->[0][$i][$col];
00746                 $temp->[0][$i][$col] = $swap;
00747             }
00748         }
00749         for ( $i = ($k + 1); $i < $n; $i++ )
00750         {
00751             # scan the remaining rows, add multiples of row $k to row $i:
00752 
00753             $swap = $temp->[0][$i][$k] / $temp->[0][$k][$k];
00754             if ($swap != 0)
00755             {
00756                 # calculate a row of matrix R:
00757 
00758                 for ( $j = ($k + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
00759                 {
00760                     $temp->[0][$i][$j] -= $temp->[0][$k][$j] * $swap;
00761                 }
00762 
00763                 # store matrix L in same matrix as R:
00764 
00765                 $temp->[0][$i][$k] = $swap;
00766             }
00767         }
00768     }
00769     my $rh_options = $temp->[3];
00770     $temp->[3] = $sign;
00771     $temp->[4] = $perm_row;
00772     $temp->[5] = $perm_col;
00773     $temp->[6] = $temp->[3];
00774     return($temp);
00775 }
00776 
00777 sub solve_LR
00778 {
00779     croak "Usage: (\$dimension,\$x_vector,\$base_matrix) = \$LR_matrix->solve_LR(\$b_vector);"
00780       if (@_ != 2);
00781 
00782     my($LR_matrix,$b_vector) = @_;
00783     my($rows,$cols) = ($LR_matrix->[1],$LR_matrix->[2]);
00784     my($dimension,$x_vector,$base_matrix);
00785     my($perm_row,$perm_col);
00786     my($y_vector,$sum);
00787     my($i,$j,$k,$n);
00788 
00789     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_LR(): not an LR decomposition matrix"
00790       unless ((defined $LR_matrix->[4]) && ($rows == $cols));
00791 
00792     $n = $rows;
00793 
00794     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_LR(): vector is not a column vector"
00795       unless ($b_vector->[2] == 1);
00796 
00797     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_LR(): matrix and vector size mismatch"
00798       unless ($b_vector->[1] == $n);
00799 
00800     $perm_row = $LR_matrix->[4];
00801     $perm_col = $LR_matrix->[5];
00802 
00803     $x_vector    =   $b_vector->new($n,1);
00804     $y_vector    =   $b_vector->new($n,1);
00805     $base_matrix = $LR_matrix->new($n,$n);
00806 
00807     # calculate "x" so that LRx = b  ==>  calculate Ly = b, Rx = y:
00808 
00809     for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ ) # calculate $y_vector:
00810     {
00811         $sum = $b_vector->[0][($perm_row->[$i])][0];
00812         for ( $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++ )
00813         {
00814             $sum -= $LR_matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $y_vector->[0][$j][0];
00815         }
00816         $y_vector->[0][$i][0] = $sum;
00817     }
00818 
00819     $dimension = 0;
00820     for ( $i = ($n - 1); $i >= 0; $i-- ) # calculate $x_vector:
00821     {
00822         if ($LR_matrix->[0][$i][$i] == 0)
00823         {
00824             if ($y_vector->[0][$i][0] != 0)
00825             {
00826                 return(); # a solution does not exist!
00827             }
00828             else
00829             {
00830                 $dimension++;
00831                 $x_vector->[0][($perm_col->[$i])][0] = 0;
00832             }
00833         }
00834         else
00835         {
00836             $sum = $y_vector->[0][$i][0];
00837             for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
00838             {
00839                 $sum -= $LR_matrix->[0][$i][$j] *
00840                     $x_vector->[0][($perm_col->[$j])][0];
00841             }
00842             $x_vector->[0][($perm_col->[$i])][0] =
00843                 $sum / $LR_matrix->[0][$i][$i];
00844         }
00845     }
00846     if ($dimension)
00847     {
00848         if ($dimension == $n)
00849         {
00850             $base_matrix->one();
00851         }
00852         else
00853         {
00854             for ( $k = 0; $k < $dimension; $k++ )
00855             {
00856                 $base_matrix->[0][($perm_col->[($n-$k-1)])][$k] = 1;
00857                 for ( $i = ($n-$dimension-1); $i >= 0; $i-- )
00858                 {
00859                     $sum = 0;
00860                     for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
00861                     {
00862                         $sum -= $LR_matrix->[0][$i][$j] *
00863                             $base_matrix->[0][($perm_col->[$j])][$k];
00864                     }
00865                     $base_matrix->[0][($perm_col->[$i])][$k] =
00866                         $sum / $LR_matrix->[0][$i][$i];
00867                 }
00868             }
00869         }
00870     }
00871     return( $dimension, $x_vector, $base_matrix );
00872 }
00873 
00874 sub invert_LR
00875 {
00876     croak "Usage: \$inverse_matrix = \$LR_matrix->invert_LR();"
00877       if (@_ != 1);
00878 
00879     my($matrix) = @_;
00880     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00881     my($inv_matrix,$x_vector,$y_vector);
00882     my($i,$j,$n);
00883 
00884     croak "MatrixReal1::invert_LR(): not an LR decomposition matrix"
00885       unless ((defined $matrix->[4]) && ($rows == $cols));
00886 
00887     $n = $rows;
00888     if ($matrix->[0][$n-1][$n-1] != 0)
00889     {
00890         $inv_matrix = $matrix->new($n,$n);
00891         $y_vector   = $matrix->new($n,1);
00892         for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
00893         {
00894             if ($j > 0)
00895             {
00896                 $y_vector->[0][$j-1][0] = 0;
00897             }
00898             $y_vector->[0][$j][0] = 1;
00899             if (($rows,$x_vector,$cols) = $matrix->solve_LR($y_vector))
00900             {
00901                 for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
00902                 {
00903                     $inv_matrix->[0][$i][$j] = $x_vector->[0][$i][0];
00904                 }
00905             }
00906             else
00907             {
00908                 die "MatrixReal1::invert_LR(): unexpected error - please inform author!\n";
00909             }
00910         }
00911         return($inv_matrix);
00912     }
00913     else { return(); } # matrix is not invertible!
00914 }
00915 
00916 sub condition
00917 {
00918     # 1st matrix MUST be the inverse of 2nd matrix (or vice-versa)
00919     # for a meaningful result!
00920 
00921     croak "Usage: \$condition = \$matrix->condition(\$inverse_matrix);"
00922       if (@_ != 2);
00923 
00924     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00925     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00926     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00927 
00928     croak "MatrixReal1::condition(): 1st matrix is not quadratic"
00929       unless ($rows1 == $cols1);
00930 
00931     croak "MatrixReal1::condition(): 2nd matrix is not quadratic"
00932       unless ($rows2 == $cols2);
00933 
00934     croak "MatrixReal1::condition(): matrix size mismatch"
00935       unless (($rows1 == $rows2) && ($cols1 == $cols2));
00936 
00937     return( $matrix1->norm_one() * $matrix2->norm_one() );
00938 }
00939 
00940 sub det_LR  #  determinant of LR decomposition matrix
00941 {
00942     croak "Usage: \$determinant = \$LR_matrix->det_LR();"
00943       if (@_ != 1);
00944 
00945     my($matrix) = @_;
00946     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00947     my($k,$det);
00948 
00949     croak "MatrixReal1::det_LR(): not an LR decomposition matrix"
00950  #   unless ((defined $matrix->[3]) && ($rows == $cols));
00951     unless ((defined $matrix->[4]) && ($rows == $cols)); #options might be in [3] position-- MEG
00952 
00953     $det = $matrix->[3];   # grab the sign from permutation shifts
00954     for ( $k = 0; $k < $rows; $k++ )
00955     {
00956         $det *= $matrix->[0][$k][$k];
00957     }
00958     return($det);
00959 }
00960 
00961 sub order_LR  #  order of LR decomposition matrix (number of non-zero equations)
00962 {
00963     croak "Usage: \$order = \$LR_matrix->order_LR();"
00964       if (@_ != 1);
00965 
00966     my($matrix) = @_;
00967     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00968     my($order);
00969 
00970     croak "MatrixReal1::order_LR(): not an LR decomposition matrix"
00971       unless ((defined $matrix->[4]) && ($rows == $cols));
00972 
00973     ZERO:
00974     for ( $order = ($rows - 1); $order >= 0; $order-- )
00975     {
00976         last ZERO if ($matrix->[0][$order][$order] != 0);
00977     }
00978     return(++$order);
00979 }
00980 
00981 sub scalar_product
00982 {
00983     croak "Usage: \$scalar_product = \$vector1->scalar_product(\$vector2);"
00984       if (@_ != 2);
00985 
00986     my($vector1,$vector2) = @_;
00987     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($vector1->[1],$vector1->[2]);
00988     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($vector2->[1],$vector2->[2]);
00989     my($k,$sum);
00990 
00991     croak "MatrixReal1::scalar_product(): 1st vector is not a column vector"
00992       unless ($cols1 == 1);
00993 
00994     croak "MatrixReal1::scalar_product(): 2nd vector is not a column vector"
00995       unless ($cols2 == 1);
00996 
00997     croak "MatrixReal1::scalar_product(): vector size mismatch"
00998       unless ($rows1 == $rows2);
00999 
01000     $sum = 0;
01001     for ( $k = 0; $k < $rows1; $k++ )
01002     {
01003         $sum += $vector1->[0][$k][0] * $vector2->[0][$k][0];
01004     }
01005     return($sum);
01006 }
01007 
01008 sub vector_product
01009 {
01010     croak "Usage: \$vector_product = \$vector1->vector_product(\$vector2);"
01011       if (@_ != 2);
01012 
01013     my($vector1,$vector2) = @_;
01014     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($vector1->[1],$vector1->[2]);
01015     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($vector2->[1],$vector2->[2]);
01016     my($temp);
01017     my($n);
01018 
01019     croak "MatrixReal1::vector_product(): 1st vector is not a column vector"
01020       unless ($cols1 == 1);
01021 
01022     croak "MatrixReal1::vector_product(): 2nd vector is not a column vector"
01023       unless ($cols2 == 1);
01024 
01025     croak "MatrixReal1::vector_product(): vector size mismatch"
01026       unless ($rows1 == $rows2);
01027 
01028     $n = $rows1;
01029 
01030     croak "MatrixReal1::vector_product(): only defined for 3 dimensions"
01031       unless ($n == 3);
01032 
01033     $temp = $vector1->new($n,1);
01034     $temp->[0][0][0] = $vector1->[0][1][0] * $vector2->[0][2][0] -
01035                        $vector1->[0][2][0] * $vector2->[0][1][0];
01036     $temp->[0][1][0] = $vector1->[0][2][0] * $vector2->[0][0][0] -
01037                        $vector1->[0][0][0] * $vector2->[0][2][0];
01038     $temp->[0][2][0] = $vector1->[0][0][0] * $vector2->[0][1][0] -
01039                        $vector1->[0][1][0] * $vector2->[0][0][0];
01040     return($temp);
01041 }
01042 
01043 sub length
01044 {
01045     croak "Usage: \$length = \$vector->length();"
01046       if (@_ != 1);
01047 
01048     my($vector) = @_;
01049     my($rows,$cols) = ($vector->[1],$vector->[2]);
01050     my($k,$comp,$sum);
01051 
01052     croak "MatrixReal1::length(): vector is not a column vector"
01053       unless ($cols == 1);
01054 
01055     $sum = 0;
01056     for ( $k = 0; $k < $rows; $k++ )
01057     {
01058         $comp = $vector->[0][$k][0];
01059         $sum += $comp * $comp;
01060     }
01061     return( sqrt( $sum ) );
01062 }
01063 
01064 sub _init_iteration
01065 {
01066     croak "Usage: \$which_norm = \$matrix->_init_iteration();"
01067       if (@_ != 1);
01068 
01069     my($matrix) = @_;
01070     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
01071     my($ok,$max,$sum,$norm);
01072     my($i,$j,$n);
01073 
01074     croak "MatrixReal1::_init_iteration(): matrix is not quadratic"
01075       unless ($rows == $cols);
01076 
01077     $ok = 1;
01078     $n = $rows;
01079     for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01080     {
01081         if ($matrix->[0][$i][$i] == 0) { $ok = 0; }
01082     }
01083     if ($ok)
01084     {
01085         $norm = 1; # norm_one
01086         $max = 0;
01087         for ( $j = 0; $j < $n; $j++ )
01088         {
01089             $sum = 0;
01090             for ( $i = 0; $i < $j; $i++ )
01091             {
01092                 $sum += abs($matrix->[0][$i][$j]);
01093             }
01094             for ( $i = ($j + 1); $i < $n; $i++ )
01095             {
01096                 $sum += abs($matrix->[0][$i][$j]);
01097             }
01098             $sum /= abs($matrix->[0][$j][$j]);
01099             if ($sum > $max) { $max = $sum; }
01100         }
01101         $ok = ($max < 1);
01102         unless ($ok)
01103         {
01104             $norm = -1; # norm_max
01105             $max = 0;
01106             for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01107             {
01108                 $sum = 0;
01109                 for ( $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++ )
01110                 {
01111                     $sum += abs($matrix->[0][$i][$j]);
01112                 }
01113                 for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
01114                 {
01115                     $sum += abs($matrix->[0][$i][$j]);
01116                 }
01117                 $sum /= abs($matrix->[0][$i][$i]);
01118                 if ($sum > $max) { $max = $sum; }
01119             }
01120             $ok = ($max < 1)
01121         }
01122     }
01123     if ($ok) { return($norm); }
01124     else     { return(0); }
01125 }
01126 
01127 sub solve_GSM  #  Global Step Method
01128 {
01129     croak "Usage: \$xn_vector = \$matrix->solve_GSM(\$x0_vector,\$b_vector,\$epsilon);"
01130       if (@_ != 4);
01131 
01132     my($matrix,$x0_vector,$b_vector,$epsilon) = @_;
01133     my($rows1,$cols1) = (   $matrix->[1],   $matrix->[2]);
01134     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($x0_vector->[1],$x0_vector->[2]);
01135     my($rows3,$cols3) = ( $b_vector->[1], $b_vector->[2]);
01136     my($norm,$sum,$diff);
01137     my($xn_vector);
01138     my($i,$j,$n);
01139 
01140     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_GSM(): matrix is not quadratic"
01141       unless ($rows1 == $cols1);
01142 
01143     $n = $rows1;
01144 
01145     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_GSM(): 1st vector is not a column vector"
01146       unless ($cols2 == 1);
01147 
01148     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_GSM(): 2nd vector is not a column vector"
01149       unless ($cols3 == 1);
01150 
01151     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_GSM(): matrix and vector size mismatch"
01152       unless (($rows2 == $n) && ($rows3 == $n));
01153 
01154     return() unless ($norm = $matrix->_init_iteration());
01155 
01156     $xn_vector = $x0_vector->new($n,1);
01157 
01158     $diff = $epsilon + 1;
01159     while ($diff >= $epsilon)
01160     {
01161         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01162         {
01163             $sum = $b_vector->[0][$i][0];
01164             for ( $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++ )
01165             {
01166                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $x0_vector->[0][$j][0];
01167             }
01168             for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
01169             {
01170                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $x0_vector->[0][$j][0];
01171             }
01172             $xn_vector->[0][$i][0] = $sum / $matrix->[0][$i][$i];
01173         }
01174         $x0_vector->subtract($x0_vector,$xn_vector);
01175         if ($norm > 0) { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_one(); }
01176         else           { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_max(); }
01177         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01178         {
01179             $x0_vector->[0][$i][0] = $xn_vector->[0][$i][0];
01180         }
01181     }
01182     return($xn_vector);
01183 }
01184 
01185 sub solve_SSM  #  Single Step Method
01186 {
01187     croak "Usage: \$xn_vector = \$matrix->solve_SSM(\$x0_vector,\$b_vector,\$epsilon);"
01188       if (@_ != 4);
01189 
01190     my($matrix,$x0_vector,$b_vector,$epsilon) = @_;
01191     my($rows1,$cols1) = (   $matrix->[1],   $matrix->[2]);
01192     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($x0_vector->[1],$x0_vector->[2]);
01193     my($rows3,$cols3) = ( $b_vector->[1], $b_vector->[2]);
01194     my($norm,$sum,$diff);
01195     my($xn_vector);
01196     my($i,$j,$n);
01197 
01198     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_SSM(): matrix is not quadratic"
01199       unless ($rows1 == $cols1);
01200 
01201     $n = $rows1;
01202 
01203     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_SSM(): 1st vector is not a column vector"
01204       unless ($cols2 == 1);
01205 
01206     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_SSM(): 2nd vector is not a column vector"
01207       unless ($cols3 == 1);
01208 
01209     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_SSM(): matrix and vector size mismatch"
01210       unless (($rows2 == $n) && ($rows3 == $n));
01211 
01212     return() unless ($norm = $matrix->_init_iteration());
01213 
01214     $xn_vector = $x0_vector->new($n,1);
01215     $xn_vector->copy($x0_vector);
01216 
01217     $diff = $epsilon + 1;
01218     while ($diff >= $epsilon)
01219     {
01220         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01221         {
01222             $sum = $b_vector->[0][$i][0];
01223             for ( $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++ )
01224             {
01225                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $xn_vector->[0][$j][0];
01226             }
01227             for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
01228             {
01229                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $xn_vector->[0][$j][0];
01230             }
01231             $xn_vector->[0][$i][0] = $sum / $matrix->[0][$i][$i];
01232         }
01233         $x0_vector->subtract($x0_vector,$xn_vector);
01234         if ($norm > 0) { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_one(); }
01235         else           { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_max(); }
01236         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01237         {
01238             $x0_vector->[0][$i][0] = $xn_vector->[0][$i][0];
01239         }
01240     }
01241     return($xn_vector);
01242 }
01243 
01244 sub solve_RM  #  Relaxation Method
01245 {
01246     croak "Usage: \$xn_vector = \$matrix->solve_RM(\$x0_vector,\$b_vector,\$weight,\$epsilon);"
01247       if (@_ != 5);
01248 
01249     my($matrix,$x0_vector,$b_vector,$weight,$epsilon) = @_;
01250     my($rows1,$cols1) = (   $matrix->[1],   $matrix->[2]);
01251     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($x0_vector->[1],$x0_vector->[2]);
01252     my($rows3,$cols3) = ( $b_vector->[1], $b_vector->[2]);
01253     my($norm,$sum,$diff);
01254     my($xn_vector);
01255     my($i,$j,$n);
01256 
01257     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_RM(): matrix is not quadratic"
01258       unless ($rows1 == $cols1);
01259 
01260     $n = $rows1;
01261 
01262     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_RM(): 1st vector is not a column vector"
01263       unless ($cols2 == 1);
01264 
01265     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_RM(): 2nd vector is not a column vector"
01266       unless ($cols3 == 1);
01267 
01268     croak "MatrixReal1::solve_RM(): matrix and vector size mismatch"
01269       unless (($rows2 == $n) && ($rows3 == $n));
01270 
01271     return() unless ($norm = $matrix->_init_iteration());
01272 
01273     $xn_vector = $x0_vector->new($n,1);
01274     $xn_vector->copy($x0_vector);
01275 
01276     $diff = $epsilon + 1;
01277     while ($diff >= $epsilon)
01278     {
01279         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01280         {
01281             $sum = $b_vector->[0][$i][0];
01282             for ( $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++ )
01283             {
01284                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $xn_vector->[0][$j][0];
01285             }
01286             for ( $j = ($i + 1); $j < $n; $j++ )
01287             {
01288                 $sum -= $matrix->[0][$i][$j] * $xn_vector->[0][$j][0];
01289             }
01290             $xn_vector->[0][$i][0] = $weight * ( $sum / $matrix->[0][$i][$i] )
01291                                    + (1 - $weight) * $xn_vector->[0][$i][0];
01292         }
01293         $x0_vector->subtract($x0_vector,$xn_vector);
01294         if ($norm > 0) { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_one(); }
01295         else           { $diff = $x0_vector->norm_max(); }
01296         for ( $i = 0; $i < $n; $i++ )
01297         {
01298             $x0_vector->[0][$i][0] = $xn_vector->[0][$i][0];
01299         }
01300     }
01301     return($xn_vector);
01302 }
01303 
01304 # Core householder reduction routine (when eagenvector
01305 # are wanted).
01306 # Adapted from: Numerical Recipes, 2nd edition.
01307 sub _householder_vectors ($)
01308 {
01309     my ($Q) = @_;
01310     my ($rows, $cols) = ($Q->[1], $Q->[2]);
01311     
01312     # Creates tridiagonal
01313     # Set up tridiagonal needed elements
01314     my $d = []; # N Diagonal elements 0...n-1
01315     my $e = []; # N-1 Off-Diagonal elements 0...n-2
01316     
01317     my @p = ();
01318     for (my $i = ($rows-1); $i > 1; $i--)
01319     {
01320     my $scale = 0.0;
01321     # Computes norm of one column (below diagonal)
01322     for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01323     {
01324         $scale += abs($Q->[0][$i][$k]);
01325     }
01326     if ($scale == 0.0)
01327     { # skip the transformation
01328         $e->[$i-1] = $Q->[0][$i][$i-1];
01329     }
01330     else
01331     {
01332         my $h = 0.0;
01333         for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01334         { # Used scaled Q for transformation
01335         $Q->[0][$i][$k] /= $scale;
01336         # Form sigma in h
01337         $h += $Q->[0][$i][$k] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01338         }
01339         my $t1 = $Q->[0][$i][$i-1];
01340         my $t2 = (($t1 >= 0.0) ? -sqrt($h) : sqrt($h));
01341         $e->[$i-1] = $scale * $t2; # Update off-diagonals
01342         $h -= $t1 * $t2;
01343         $Q->[0][$i][$i-1] -= $t2;
01344         my $f = 0.0;
01345         for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01346         {
01347         $Q->[0][$j][$i] = $Q->[0][$i][$j] / $h;
01348         my $g = 0.0;
01349         for (my $k = 0; $k <= $j; $k++)
01350         {
01351             $g += $Q->[0][$j][$k] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01352         }
01353         for (my $k = $j+1; $k < $i; $k++)
01354         {
01355             $g += $Q->[0][$k][$j] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01356         }
01357         # Form elements of P
01358         $p[$j] = $g / $h;
01359         $f += $p[$j] * $Q->[0][$i][$j];
01360         }
01361         my $hh = $f / ($h + $h);
01362         for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01363         {
01364         my $t3 = $Q->[0][$i][$j];
01365         my $t4 = $p[$j] - $hh * $t3;
01366         $p[$j] = $t4;
01367         for (my $k = 0; $k <= $j; $k++)
01368         {
01369             $Q->[0][$j][$k] -= $t3 * $p[$k]
01370             + $t4 * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01371         }
01372         }
01373     }
01374     }
01375     # Updates for i == 0,1
01376     $e->[0] = $Q->[0][1][0];    
01377     $d->[0] = $Q->[0][0][0]; # i==0
01378     $Q->[0][0][0] = 1.0;
01379     $d->[1] = $Q->[0][1][1]; # i==1
01380     $Q->[0][1][1] = 1.0;
01381     $Q->[0][1][0] = $Q->[0][0][1] = 0.0;
01382     for (my $i = 2; $i < $rows; $i++)
01383     {
01384     for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01385     {
01386         my $g = 0.0;
01387         for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01388         {
01389         $g += $Q->[0][$i][$k] * $Q->[0][$k][$j];
01390         }
01391         for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01392         {
01393         $Q->[0][$k][$j] -= $g * $Q->[0][$k][$i];
01394         }
01395     }
01396     $d->[$i] = $Q->[0][$i][$i];
01397     # Reset row and column of Q for next iteration
01398     $Q->[0][$i][$i] = 1.0;
01399     for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01400     {
01401         $Q->[0][$i][$j] = $Q->[0][$j][$i] = 0.0;
01402     }
01403     }
01404     return ($d, $e);
01405 }
01406 
01407 # Computes sqrt(a*a + b*b), but more carefully...
01408 sub _pythag ($$)
01409 {
01410     my ($a, $b) = @_;
01411     my $aa = abs($a);
01412     my $ab = abs($b);
01413     if ($aa > $ab)
01414     {
01415     # NB: Not needed!: return 0.0 if ($aa == 0.0);
01416     my $t = $ab / $aa;
01417     return ($aa * sqrt(1.0 + $t*$t));
01418     }
01419     else
01420     {
01421     return 0.0 if ($ab == 0.0);
01422     my $t = $aa / $ab;
01423     return ($ab * sqrt(1.0 + $t*$t));
01424     }
01425 }
01426 
01427 # QL algorithm with implicit shifts to determine the eigenvalues
01428 # of a tridiagonal matrix. Internal routine.
01429 sub _tridiagonal_QLimplicit
01430 {
01431     my ($EV, $d, $e) = @_;
01432     my ($rows, $cols) = ($EV->[1], $EV->[2]);
01433 
01434     $e->[$rows-1] = 0.0;
01435     # Start real computation
01436     for (my $l = 0; $l < $rows; $l++)
01437     {
01438     my $iter = 0;
01439     my $m;
01440     OUTER:
01441     do {
01442         for ($m = $l; $m < ($rows - 1); $m++)
01443         {
01444         my $dd = abs($d->[$m]) + abs($d->[$m+1]);
01445         last if ((abs($e->[$m]) + $dd) == $dd);
01446         }
01447         if ($m != $l)
01448         {
01449         croak("Too many iterations!") if ($iter++ >= 30);
01450         my $g = ($d->[$l+1] - $d->[$l])
01451             / (2.0 * $e->[$l]);
01452         my $r = _pythag($g, 1.0);
01453         $g = $d->[$m] - $d->[$l]
01454             + $e->[$l] / ($g + (($g >= 0.0) ? abs($r) : -abs($r)));
01455         my ($p,$s,$c) = (0.0, 1.0,1.0);
01456         for (my $i = ($m-1); $i >= $l; $i--)
01457         {
01458             my $ii = $i + 1;
01459             my $f = $s * $e->[$i];
01460             my $t = _pythag($f, $g);
01461             $e->[$ii] = $t;
01462             if ($t == 0.0)
01463             {
01464             $d->[$ii] -= $p;
01465             $e->[$m] = 0.0;
01466             next OUTER;
01467             }
01468             my $b = $c * $e->[$i];
01469             $s = $f / $t;
01470             $c = $g / $t;
01471             $g = $d->[$ii] - $p;
01472             my $t2 = ($d->[$i] - $g) * $s + 2.0 * $c * $b;
01473             $p = $s * $t2;
01474             $d->[$ii] = $g + $p;
01475             $g = $c * $t2 - $b;
01476             for (my $k = 0; $k < $rows; $k++)
01477             {
01478             my $t1 = $EV->[0][$k][$ii];
01479             my $t2 = $EV->[0][$k][$i];
01480             $EV->[0][$k][$ii] = $s * $t2 + $c * $t1;
01481             $EV->[0][$k][$i] = $c * $t2 - $s * $t1;
01482             }
01483         }
01484         $d->[$l] -= $p;
01485         $e->[$l] = $g;
01486         $e->[$m] = 0.0;
01487         }
01488     } while ($m != $l);
01489     }
01490     return;
01491 }
01492 
01493 # Core householder reduction routine (when eagenvector
01494 # are NOT wanted).
01495 sub _householder_values ($)
01496 {
01497     my ($Q) = @_; # NB: Q is destroyed on output...
01498     my ($rows, $cols) = ($Q->[1], $Q->[2]);
01499     
01500     # Creates tridiagonal
01501     # Set up tridiagonal needed elements
01502     my $d = []; # N Diagonal elements 0...n-1
01503     my $e = []; # N-1 Off-Diagonal elements 0...n-2
01504     
01505     my @p = ();
01506     for (my $i = ($rows - 1); $i > 1; $i--)
01507     {
01508     my $scale = 0.0;
01509     for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01510     {
01511         $scale += abs($Q->[0][$i][$k]);
01512     }
01513     if ($scale == 0.0)
01514     { # skip the transformation
01515         $e->[$i-1] = $Q->[0][$i][$i-1];
01516     }
01517     else
01518     {
01519         my $h = 0.0;
01520         for (my $k = 0; $k < $i; $k++)
01521         { # Used scaled Q for transformation
01522         $Q->[0][$i][$k] /= $scale;
01523         # Form sigma in h
01524         $h += $Q->[0][$i][$k] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01525         }
01526         my $t = $Q->[0][$i][$i-1];
01527         my $t2 = (($t >= 0.0) ? -sqrt($h) : sqrt($h));
01528         $e->[$i-1] = $scale * $t2; # Updates off-diagonal
01529         $h -= $t * $t2;
01530         $Q->[0][$i][$i-1] -= $t2;
01531         my $f = 0.0;
01532         for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01533         {
01534         my $g = 0.0;
01535         for (my $k = 0; $k <= $j; $k++)
01536         {
01537             $g += $Q->[0][$j][$k] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01538         }
01539         for (my $k = $j+1; $k < $i; $k++)
01540         {
01541             $g += $Q->[0][$k][$j] * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01542         }
01543         # Form elements of P
01544         $p[$j] = $g / $h;
01545         $f += $p[$j] * $Q->[0][$i][$j];
01546         }
01547         my $hh = $f / ($h + $h);
01548         for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01549         {
01550         my $t = $Q->[0][$i][$j];
01551         my $g = $p[$j] - $hh * $t;
01552         $p[$j] = $g;
01553         for (my $k = 0; $k <= $j; $k++)
01554         {
01555             $Q->[0][$j][$k] -= $t * $p[$k]
01556             + $g * $Q->[0][$i][$k];
01557         }
01558         }
01559     }
01560     }
01561     # Updates for i==1
01562     $e->[0] =  $Q->[0][1][0];
01563     # Updates diagonal elements
01564     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01565     {
01566     $d->[$i] =  $Q->[0][$i][$i];
01567     }
01568     return ($d, $e);
01569 }
01570 
01571 # QL algorithm with implicit shifts to determine the
01572 # eigenvalues ONLY. This is O(N^2) only...
01573 sub _tridiagonal_QLimplicit_values
01574 {
01575     my ($M, $d, $e) = @_; # NB: M is not touched...
01576     my ($rows, $cols) = ($M->[1], $M->[2]);
01577 
01578     $e->[$rows-1] = 0.0;
01579     # Start real computation
01580     for (my $l = 0; $l < $rows; $l++)
01581     {
01582     my $iter = 0;
01583     my $m;
01584     OUTER:
01585     do {
01586         for ($m = $l; $m < ($rows - 1); $m++)
01587         {
01588         my $dd = abs($d->[$m]) + abs($d->[$m+1]);
01589         last if ((abs($e->[$m]) + $dd) == $dd);
01590         }
01591         if ($m != $l)
01592         {
01593         croak("Too many iterations!") if ($iter++ >= 30);
01594         my $g = ($d->[$l+1] - $d->[$l])
01595             / (2.0 * $e->[$l]);
01596         my $r = _pythag($g, 1.0);
01597         $g = $d->[$m] - $d->[$l]
01598             + $e->[$l] / ($g + (($g >= 0.0) ? abs($r) : -abs($r)));
01599         my ($p,$s,$c) = (0.0, 1.0,1.0);
01600         for (my $i = ($m-1); $i >= $l; $i--)
01601         {
01602             my $ii = $i + 1;
01603             my $f = $s * $e->[$i];
01604             my $t = _pythag($f, $g);
01605             $e->[$ii] = $t;
01606             if ($t == 0.0)
01607             {
01608             $d->[$ii] -= $p;
01609             $e->[$m] = 0.0;
01610             next OUTER;
01611             }
01612             my $b = $c * $e->[$i];
01613             $s = $f / $t;
01614             $c = $g / $t;
01615             $g = $d->[$ii] - $p;
01616             my $t2 = ($d->[$i] - $g) * $s + 2.0 * $c * $b;
01617             $p = $s * $t2;
01618             $d->[$ii] = $g + $p;
01619             $g = $c * $t2 - $b;
01620         }
01621         $d->[$l] -= $p;
01622         $e->[$l] = $g;
01623         $e->[$m] = 0.0;
01624         }
01625     } while ($m != $l);
01626     }
01627     return;
01628 }
01629 
01630 # Householder reduction of a real, symmetric matrix A.
01631 # Returns a tridiagonal matrix T and the orthogonal matrix
01632 # Q effecting the transformation between A and T.
01633 sub householder ($)
01634 {
01635     my ($A) = @_;
01636     my ($rows, $cols) = ($A->[1], $A->[2]);
01637 
01638     croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01639     unless ($rows = $cols);
01640     croak "Matrix is not symmetric"
01641         unless ($A->is_symmetric());
01642 
01643     # Copy given matrix TODO: study if we should do in-place modification
01644     my $Q = $A->clone();
01645 
01646     # Do the computation of tridiagonal elements and of
01647     # transformation matrix
01648     my ($diag, $offdiag) = $Q->_householder_vectors();
01649 
01650     # Creates the tridiagonal matrix
01651     my $T = $A->shadow();
01652     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01653     { # Set diagonal
01654     $T->[0][$i][$i] = $diag->[$i];
01655     }
01656     for (my $i = 0; $i < ($rows-1); $i++)
01657     { # Set off diagonals
01658     $T->[0][$i+1][$i] = $offdiag->[$i];
01659     $T->[0][$i][$i+1] = $offdiag->[$i];
01660     }
01661     return ($T, $Q);
01662 }
01663 
01664 # QL algorithm with implicit shifts to determine the eigenvalues
01665 # and eigenvectors of a real tridiagonal matrix - or of a matrix
01666 # previously reduced to tridiagonal form.
01667 sub tri_diagonalize ($;$)
01668 {
01669   my ($T,$Q) = @_; # Q may be 0 if the original matrix is really tridiagonal
01670 
01671   my ($rows, $cols) = ($T->[1], $T->[2]);
01672 
01673   croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01674     unless ($rows = $cols);
01675   croak "Matrix is not tridiagonal"
01676         unless ($T->is_symmetric()); # TODO: Do real tridiag check (not symmetric)!
01677 
01678   my $EV;
01679   # Obtain/Creates the todo eigenvectors matrix
01680   if ($Q)
01681     {
01682       $EV = $Q->clone();
01683     }
01684   else
01685     {
01686       $EV = $T->shadow();
01687       $EV->one();
01688     }
01689   # Allocates diagonal vector
01690   my $diag = [ ];
01691   # Initializes it with T
01692   for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01693     {
01694       $diag->[$i] = $T->[0][$i][$i];
01695     }
01696   # Allocate temporary vector for off-diagonal elements
01697   my $offdiag = [ ];
01698   for (my $i = 1; $i < $rows; $i++)
01699     {
01700       $offdiag->[$i-1] = $T->[0][$i][$i-1];
01701     }
01702 
01703   # Calls the calculus routine
01704   $EV->_tridiagonal_QLimplicit($diag, $offdiag);
01705 
01706   # Allocate eigenvalues vector
01707   my $v = MatrixReal1->new($rows,1);
01708   # Fills it
01709   for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01710     {
01711     $v->[0][$i][0] = $diag->[$i];
01712     }
01713   return ($v, $EV);
01714 }
01715 
01716 # Main routine for diagonalization of a real symmetric
01717 # matrix M. Operates by transforming M into a tridiagonal
01718 # matrix and then obtaining the eigenvalues and eigenvectors
01719 # for that matrix (taking into account the transformation to
01720 # tridiagonal).
01721 sub sym_diagonalize ($)
01722 {
01723     my ($M) = @_;
01724     my ($rows, $cols) = ($M->[1], $M->[2]);
01725     
01726     croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01727     unless ($rows = $cols);
01728     croak "Matrix is not symmetric"
01729         unless ($M->is_symmetric());
01730     
01731     # Copy initial matrix
01732     # TODO: study if we should allow in-place modification
01733     my $VEC = $M->clone();
01734 
01735     # Do the computation of tridiagonal elements and of
01736     # transformation matrix
01737     my ($diag, $offdiag) = $VEC->_householder_vectors();
01738     # Calls the calculus routine for diagonalization
01739     $VEC->_tridiagonal_QLimplicit($diag, $offdiag);
01740 
01741     # Allocate eigenvalues vector
01742     my $val = MatrixReal1->new($rows,1);
01743     # Fills it
01744     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01745     {
01746     $val->[0][$i][0] = $diag->[$i];
01747     }
01748     return ($val, $VEC);
01749 }
01750 
01751 # Householder reduction of a real, symmetric matrix A.
01752 # Returns a tridiagonal matrix T equivalent to A.
01753 sub householder_tridiagonal ($)
01754 {
01755     my ($A) = @_;
01756     my ($rows, $cols) = ($A->[1], $A->[2]);
01757 
01758     croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01759     unless ($rows = $cols);
01760     croak "Matrix is not symmetric"
01761         unless ($A->is_symmetric());
01762 
01763     # Copy given matrix
01764     my $Q = $A->clone();
01765 
01766     # Do the computation of tridiagonal elements and of
01767     # transformation matrix
01768     # Q is destroyed after reduction
01769     my ($diag, $offdiag) = $Q->_householder_values();
01770 
01771     # Creates the tridiagonal matrix in Q (avoid allocation)
01772     my $T = $Q;
01773     $T->zero();
01774     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01775     { # Set diagonal
01776     $T->[0][$i][$i] = $diag->[$i];
01777     }
01778     for (my $i = 0; $i < ($rows-1); $i++)
01779     { # Set off diagonals
01780     $T->[0][$i+1][$i] = $offdiag->[$i];
01781     $T->[0][$i][$i+1] = $offdiag->[$i];
01782     }
01783     return $T;
01784 }
01785 
01786 # QL algorithm with implicit shifts to determine ONLY
01787 # the eigenvalues a real tridiagonal matrix - or of a
01788 # matrix previously reduced to tridiagonal form.
01789 sub tri_eigenvalues ($;$)
01790 {
01791   my ($T) = @_;
01792   my ($rows, $cols) = ($T->[1], $T->[2]);
01793 
01794   croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01795     unless ($rows = $cols);
01796   croak "Matrix is not tridiagonal"
01797         unless ($T->is_symmetric()); # TODO: Do real tridiag check (not symmetric)!
01798 
01799   # Allocates diagonal vector
01800   my $diag = [ ];
01801   # Initializes it with T
01802   for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01803     {
01804       $diag->[$i] = $T->[0][$i][$i];
01805     }
01806   # Allocate temporary vector for off-diagonal elements
01807   my $offdiag = [ ];
01808   for (my $i = 1; $i < $rows; $i++)
01809     {
01810       $offdiag->[$i-1] = $T->[0][$i][$i-1];
01811     }
01812 
01813   # Calls the calculus routine (T is not touched)
01814   $T->_tridiagonal_QLimplicit_values($diag, $offdiag);
01815 
01816   # Allocate eigenvalues vector
01817   my $v = MatrixReal1->new($rows,1);
01818   # Fills it
01819   for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01820     {
01821     $v->[0][$i][0] = $diag->[$i];
01822     }
01823   return $v;
01824 }
01825 
01826 # Main routine for diagonalization of a real symmetric
01827 # matrix M. Operates by transforming M into a tridiagonal
01828 # matrix and then obtaining the eigenvalues and eigenvectors
01829 # for that matrix (taking into account the transformation to
01830 # tridiagonal).
01831 sub sym_eigenvalues ($)
01832 {
01833     my ($M) = @_;
01834     my ($rows, $cols) = ($M->[1], $M->[2]);
01835     
01836     croak "Matrix is not quadratic"
01837     unless ($rows = $cols);
01838     croak "Matrix is not symmetric"
01839         unless ($M->is_symmetric());
01840 
01841     # Copy matrix in temporary
01842     my $A = $M->clone();
01843     # Do the computation of tridiagonal elements and of
01844     # transformation matrix. A is destroyed
01845     my ($diag, $offdiag) = $A->_householder_values();
01846     # Calls the calculus routine for diagonalization
01847     # (M is not touched)
01848     $M->_tridiagonal_QLimplicit_values($diag, $offdiag);
01849 
01850     # Allocate eigenvalues vector
01851     my $val = MatrixReal1->new($rows,1);
01852     # Fills it
01853     for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++)
01854     {
01855     $val->[0][$i][0] = $diag->[$i];
01856     }
01857     return $val;
01858 }
01859 
01860 # Boolean check routine to see if a matrix is
01861 # symmetric
01862 sub is_symmetric ($)
01863 {
01864   my ($M) = @_;
01865   my ($rows, $cols) = ($M->[1], $M->[2]);
01866   # if it is not quadratic it cannot be symmetric...
01867   return 0 unless ($rows == $cols);
01868   for (my $i = 1; $i < $rows; $i++)
01869     {
01870       for (my $j = 0; $j < $i; $j++)
01871     {
01872       return 0 unless ($M->[0][$i][$j] == $M->[0][$j][$i]);
01873     }
01874     }
01875   return 1;
01876 }
01877 
01878                 ########################################
01879                 #                                      #
01880                 # define overloaded operators section: #
01881                 #                                      #
01882                 ########################################

01906 sub _boolean
01907 {
01908     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
01909 #   my($name) = "bool"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
01910     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
01911     my($i,$j,$result);
01912 
01913     $result = 0;
01914     BOOL:
01915     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
01916     {
01917         for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
01918         {
01919             if ($object->[0][$i][$j] != 0)
01920             {
01921                 $result = 1;
01922                 last BOOL;
01923             }
01924         }
01925     }
01926     return($result);
01927 }
01928 
01929 sub _not_boolean
01930 {
01931     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
01932 #   my($name) = "'!'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
01933     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
01934     my($i,$j,$result);
01935 
01936     $result = 1;
01937     NOTBOOL:
01938     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
01939     {
01940         for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
01941         {
01942             if ($object->[0][$i][$j] != 0)
01943             {
01944                 $result = 0;
01945                 last NOTBOOL;
01946             }
01947         }
01948     }
01949     return($result);
01950 }
01951 
01952 sub _stringify
01953 {
01954     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
01955 #   my($name) = '""'; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
01956     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
01957     my($i,$j,$s);
01958 
01959     $s = '';
01960     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
01961     {
01962         $s .= "[ ";
01963         for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
01964         {
01965             $s .= sprintf("% #-19.12E ", $object->[0][$i][$j]);
01966         }
01967         $s .= "]\n";
01968     }
01969     return($s);
01970 }

01973 {

01975 #   my($name) = "abs"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
01976 
01977     return( $object->norm_one() );
01978 }
01979 
01980 sub _add
01981 {
01982     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
01983     my($name) = "'+'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
01984     my($temp);
01985 
01986     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
01987         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
01988     {
01989         if (defined $flag)
01990         {
01991             $temp = $object->new($object->[1],$object->[2]);
01992             $temp->add($object,$argument);
01993             return($temp);
01994         }
01995         else
01996         {
01997             $object->add($object,$argument);
01998             return($object);
01999         }
02000     }
02001     else
02002     {
02003         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02004     }
02005 }
02006 
02007 sub _subtract
02008 {
02009     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02010     my($name) = "'-'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02011     my($temp);
02012 
02013     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02014         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02015     {
02016         if (defined $flag)
02017         {
02018             $temp = $object->new($object->[1],$object->[2]);
02019             if ($flag) { $temp->subtract($argument,$object); }
02020             else       { $temp->subtract($object,$argument); }
02021             return($temp);
02022         }
02023         else
02024         {
02025             $object->subtract($object,$argument);
02026             return($object);
02027         }
02028     }
02029     else
02030     {
02031         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02032     }
02033 }
02034 
02035 sub _multiply
02036 {
02037     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02038     my($name) = "'*'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02039     my($temp);
02040 
02041     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02042         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02043     {
02044         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02045         {
02046             return( multiply($argument,$object) );
02047         }
02048         else
02049         {
02050             return( multiply($object,$argument) );
02051         }
02052     }
02053     elsif ((defined $argument) && !(ref($argument)))
02054     {
02055         if (defined $flag)
02056         {
02057             $temp = $object->new($object->[1],$object->[2]);
02058             $temp->multiply_scalar($object,$argument);
02059             return($temp);
02060         }
02061         else
02062         {
02063             $object->multiply_scalar($object,$argument);
02064             return($object);
02065         }
02066     }
02067     else
02068     {
02069         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02070     }
02071 }

02096 
02097 sub _equal
02098 {
02099     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02100     my($name) = "'=='"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02101     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
02102     my($i,$j,$result);
02103 
02104     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02105         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02106     {
02107         $result = 1;
02108         EQUAL:
02109         for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
02110         {
02111             for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
02112             {
02113                 if ($object->[0][$i][$j] != $argument->[0][$i][$j])
02114                 {
02115                     $result = 0;
02116                     last EQUAL;
02117                 }
02118             }
02119         }
02120         return($result);
02121     }
02122     else
02123     {
02124         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02125     }
02126 }
02127 
02128 sub _not_equal
02129 {
02130     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02131     my($name) = "'!='"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02132     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
02133     my($i,$j,$result);
02134 
02135     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02136         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02137     {
02138         $result = 0;
02139         NOTEQUAL:
02140         for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
02141         {
02142             for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
02143             {
02144                 if ($object->[0][$i][$j] != $argument->[0][$i][$j])
02145                 {
02146                     $result = 1;
02147                     last NOTEQUAL;
02148                 }
02149             }
02150         }
02151         return($result);
02152     }
02153     else
02154     {
02155         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02156     }
02157 }
02158 
02159 sub _less_than
02160 {
02161     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02162     my($name) = "'<'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02163 
02164     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02165         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02166     {
02167         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02168         {
02169             return( $argument->norm_one() < $object->norm_one() );
02170         }
02171         else
02172         {
02173             return( $object->norm_one() < $argument->norm_one() );
02174         }
02175     }
02176     elsif ((defined $argument) && !(ref($argument)))
02177     {
02178         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02179         {
02180             return( abs($argument) < $object->norm_one() );
02181         }
02182         else
02183         {
02184             return( $object->norm_one() < abs($argument) );
02185         }
02186     }
02187     else
02188     {
02189         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02190     }
02191 }
02192 
02193 sub _less_than_or_equal
02194 {
02195     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02196     my($name) = "'<='"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02197 
02198     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02199         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02200     {
02201         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02202         {
02203             return( $argument->norm_one() <= $object->norm_one() );
02204         }
02205         else
02206         {
02207             return( $object->norm_one() <= $argument->norm_one() );
02208         }
02209     }
02210     elsif ((defined $argument) && !(ref($argument)))
02211     {
02212         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02213         {
02214             return( abs($argument) <= $object->norm_one() );
02215         }
02216         else
02217         {
02218             return( $object->norm_one() <= abs($argument) );
02219         }
02220     }
02221     else
02222     {
02223         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02224     }
02225 }
02226 
02227 sub _greater_than
02228 {
02229     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02230     my($name) = "'>'"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02231 
02232     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02233         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02234     {
02235         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02236         {
02237             return( $argument->norm_one() > $object->norm_one() );
02238         }
02239         else
02240         {
02241             return( $object->norm_one() > $argument->norm_one() );
02242         }
02243     }
02244     elsif ((defined $argument) && !(ref($argument)))
02245     {
02246         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02247         {
02248             return( abs($argument) > $object->norm_one() );
02249         }
02250         else
02251         {
02252             return( $object->norm_one() > abs($argument) );
02253         }
02254     }
02255     else
02256     {
02257         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02258     }
02259 }
02260 
02261 sub _greater_than_or_equal
02262 {
02263     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02264     my($name) = "'>='"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02265 
02266     if ((defined $argument) && ref($argument) &&
02267         (ref($argument) !~ /^SCALAR$|^ARRAY$|^HASH$|^CODE$|^REF$/))
02268     {
02269         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02270         {
02271             return( $argument->norm_one() >= $object->norm_one() );
02272         }
02273         else
02274         {
02275             return( $object->norm_one() >= $argument->norm_one() );
02276         }
02277     }
02278     elsif ((defined $argument) && !(ref($argument)))
02279     {
02280         if ((defined $flag) && $flag)
02281         {
02282             return( abs($argument) >= $object->norm_one() );
02283         }
02284         else
02285         {
02286             return( $object->norm_one() >= abs($argument) );
02287         }
02288     }
02289     else
02290     {
02291         croak "MatrixReal1 $name: wrong argument type";
02292     }
02293 }
02294 
02295 sub _clone
02296 {
02297     my($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02298 #   my($name) = "'='"; #&_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
02299     my($temp);
02300 
02301     $temp = $object->new($object->[1],$object->[2]);
02302     $temp->copy($object);
02303     $temp->_undo_LR();
02304     return($temp);
02305 }
02306 
02307 sub _trace
02308 {
02309     my($text,$object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
02310 
02311     unless (defined $object)   { $object   = 'undef'; };
02312     unless (defined $argument) { $argument = 'undef'; };
02313     unless (defined $flag)     { $flag     = 'undef'; };
02314     if (ref($object))   { $object   = ref($object);   }
02315     if (ref($argument)) { $argument = ref($argument); }
02316     print "$text: \$obj='$object' \$arg='$argument' \$flag='$flag'\n";
02317 }
